newsitem.title: USA: Oracle, others push for PowerPC software.
newsitem.headline: Oracle, others push for PowerPC software.

text.p: A group of leading computer companies on Monday said they will work together to port Oracle Corp's database software for the Windows NT operating system to PowerPC based computing platforms.
The group is comprised of Groupe Bull, International Business Machines Corp, Motorola Inc's Computer Group and Oracle.

By the end of September, Oracle's Universal Server will be available to customers using PowerPC based NT servers, the companies said. Oracle7 Workgroup Server and Oracle Applications will follow, the companies said.

The porting of these core Oracle products is the result of an ongoing strategic effort by Bull, IBM and Motorola to expand porting activity and bring key software applications on Windows NT to the PowerPC platform.
